page.title: 19Local Weddings
page.content: One unusual custom here concerns local weddings. Weddings usually take place on a Friday starting at 5pm. Sometimes if the weather is good, the bridal party and guests walk in procession from the Church to the Hall where there is a meal. Guests often number two or three hundred. All the food is provided by the bridal pair's family even the flour for baking the bannocks or buns. However people are asked to 'take a table' and provide dishes, cutlery etc for say 10 people as well as bake the bannocks. A dance follows often lasting until 5am with short drink and supper breaks. There is usually a second night of dancing, and for closer relations often a third night for clearing up the Hall which is specially decorated for the occasion.
